actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-796, by Ms. Slaughter (NY).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5269 with 2 hours 0 of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. All points of order against consideration of the bill shall be waived. It shall be in order to consider the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on the Judiciary now printed in the bill, as modified by the amendments printed in part 1 of the report accompanying this resolution, as an original bill for the purpose of amendment and all points of order against said modified substite shall be waived. Measure will be read by section. A specified amendment is in order. No amendment to the substitute shall be in order except those printed in part 2 of the accompanying report. Said amendments shall be considered in the order and manner specified in the report. Said amendments shall be considered as having been re...
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 175.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 5269) to control crime.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 5269 (crime control).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 5269) to control crime.
